perturbation.original_text: "Invention" means any idea, invention, discovery, know-how, data, work of authorship, information, improvement, technology, process, concept or material, whether or not patentable, copyrightable or protectable as a trade secret, and whether or not reduced to practice or memorialized in writing.
perturbation.changed_text: "Invention" means any idea, invention, discovery, know-how, data, work of authorship, information, improvement, technology, process, concept or material that is patentable, copyrightable or protectable as a trade secret, and reduced to practice or memorialized in writing.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition includes any idea, whether or not patentable. The modified definition limits it to ideas that are patentable or protectable as a trade secret and reduces practice, contradicting the broader scope typically afforded to "invention" in intellectual property law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: United States Patent Act, which does not require reduction to practice for an idea to be considered an invention.

perturbation.original_text: “Improved Conformis Background IP” means any Invention to the extent first arising in the performance of the R&D Program, whether or not embodied in the KIB Product, that constitutes an improvement to Conformis Background IP, Conformis Confidential Information (which shall not include any Confidential Information owned or commonly owned by Stryker) or the Purchased Assets, and all Intellectual Property rights underlying such Invention (but expressly excluding all Transferred IP, Conformis Foreground IP, Conformis Background IP and Stryker Background IP, and, for the avoidance of doubt, excluding all Intellectual Property rights subsisting prior to the Closing Date).
perturbation.changed_text: “Improved Conformis Background IP” means any Invention to the extent first arising in the performance of the R&D Program, that constitutes a significant advancement to Conformis Background IP, Conformis Confidential Information or the Purchased Assets, and all Intellectual Property rights underlying such Invention (but expressly excluding all Transferred IP, Conformis Foreground IP, Conformis Background IP and Stryker Background IP).
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'improvement' with 'significant advancement' elevates the standard for what qualifies as Improved Conformis Background IP. This introduces ambiguity and contradicts the standard interpretation of 'improvement' in IP law, which typically requires only a marginal enhancement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common law principles for assessing patentable improvements.

perturbation.original_text: “Confidential Information” has the meaning set forth in the Asset Purchase Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: “Confidential Information” means information Stryker deems confidential.
perturbation.explanation: By referencing the Asset Purchase Agreement, the definition of Confidential Information is clearly defined. By changing it to 'information Stryker deems confidential,' it gives Stryker broad and unilateral power to classify any information as confidential, even if it does not meet the standard legal definition of trade secret or confidential information.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common Law and the Uniform Trade Secrets Act definitions of Confidential Information.
